texts.definition: Resources in games that at least partly do not have physical locations.
markups: <style="Definition">Resources in games that at least partly do not have physical locations.</style>
Resources are a common component in many games. Those that are <style="CurrentLink">Non-Localized Resources</style> have no spatial location in a game world.

The lives players have in <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Pac-Man">Pac-Man</link></style> and <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Asteroids">Asteroids</link></style> are examples of <style="CurrentLink">Non-Localized Resources</style>. Likewise, experience points in <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Category:Roleplaying%20Games">Roleplaying Games</link></style> such as <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Dungeons%20&%20Dragons">Dungeons & Dragons</link></style> and the <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Fallout%20series">Fallout series</link></style> may be characteristics of characters but have no or little connection to the locations of those characters are and are not located specifically in any part of them.

While all <style="Link"><link="resources">Resources</link></style> in games without <style="Link"><link="game-worlds">Game Worlds</link></style> by definition are <style="CurrentLink">Non-Localized Resources</style>, it is mainly interesting to consider this pattern in contrasts to what exists in <style="Link"><link="game-worlds">Game Worlds</link></style>, so they pattern is rarely interesting to consider unless a game does in fact have a <style="Link"><link="game-worlds">Game World</link></style>. <style="CurrentLink">Non-Localized Resources</style> exists in two variants, strong or weak. In the strong variant, all instances of the <style="Link"><link="resources">Resources</link></style> are non-localized while in the weak only some instances - typically those acquired by players - are non-localized.

Typical examples of <style="Link"><link="resources">Resources</link></style> that are candidates to be used as <style="CurrentLink">Non-Localized Resources</style> include <style="Link"><link="ammunition">Ammunition</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="health">Health</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="lives">Lives</link></style>, <style="Link"><link="http://virt10.itu.chalmers.se/index.php/Money">Money</link></style>, and <style="Link"><link="scores">Scores</link></style>. While <style="Link"><link="pick-ups">Pick-Ups</link></style> may provide <style="Link"><link="resources">Resources</link></style> they typically are not movable and can thereby be seen as a source for <style="CurrentLink">Non-Localized Resources</style> without being these themselves. In games using <style="Link"><link="inventories">Inventories</link></style>, <style="CurrentLink">Non-Localized Resources</style> can be applied to some parts of these so particular <style="Link"><link="resources">Resources</link></style> are treated separately from the rest.

As its name indicates, <style="CurrentLink">Non-Localized Resources</style> are <style="Link"><link="resources">Resources</link></style> and they modify <style="Link"><link="game-worlds">Game Worlds</link></style> by their full or partial absence in these.
